column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0003] One downside to current insulated containers is the limited length of time that an insulated container can keep something cold.

#Text=For example, if ice is used in an insulated container, the ice will often melt after a relatively short period of time, because an insulated container typically cannot maintain the colder interior temperatures needed to prevent melting of the ice.
#Text=Frozen ice packs do not last much longer.
#Text=[0004] Another downside to most contemporary insulated containers is that the inside cannot be maintained at freezing temperatures for very long.
#Text=To solve this problem, many companies often use dry ice to keep the contents of an insulated container below freezing (i.e., 32 degrees Fahrenheit).
#Text=However, even dry ice has time limitations, and use and handling of dry ice can be difficult.

#Text=[0005] One solution that has recently been used for providing insulated containers that can maintain cold temperatures for long periods of time is to provide refrigeration units in the insulated containers.
#Text=However, this solution has not always been convenient.
#Text=For example, traditional vapor cycle systems, while efficient, are quite large and heavy.
#Text=In addition, such refrigeration units typically must be plugged into an AC outlet or a car cigarette lighter to provide cooling.
#Text=While such a cooling unit works well for cooling items in the insulated container, an AC outlet or similar power supply is not always readily available.
#Text=A few 12 volt or 24 volt systems are available today; however, these systems are also large and heavy.
#Text=The vapor cycle 12 and 24-volt systems also may have problems with vibrations during transportation.
#Text=[0006] In addition, there exists absorption and adsorption refrigerators, but these fail if enough vibrations exist and improper orientation may also cause the units to fail.
#Text=Like the vapor cycle refrigerators, these cooler systems are heavy and hard to handle.
#Text=[0007] The following presents a simplified summary of some embodiments of the invention in order to provide a basic understanding of the invention.
#Text=This summary is not an extensive overview of the invention.
#Text=It is not intended to identify key/critical elements of the invention or to delineate the scope of the invention.
#Text=Its sole purpose is to present some embodiments of the invention in a simplified form as a prelude to the more detailed description that is presented later.
